content:
Art. 4.230. 
Incomplete partition 
If all the property left by the ascendant on the day of his death has not been included in the partition, any such property which has not been included is partitioned in accordance with the law.
If the partition is not made between all the children existing at the time of death and the descendants of those predeceased, the partition is void in its entirety. A new partition may be requested in the legal form, either by the children or descendants who received no share in it, or even by those between whom the partition was made.
